The servers are very friendly and this is a relaxed atmosphere.  You can order at the counter or sitting down, and they have a few tables outside with heat lamps for Al fresco dining.  We had the "margherita pizza" which was covered in tomatoes and no basil... So I'd call this cheese and tomato pizza.  Also had a slic of the bacon pizza, which was fine, but nothing special.  The rela star of our meal was the onion and cheese empanada... Delicious!  Wish we had ordered several of these.  The house wine was fine, a little bubbly.  There's a younger crowd here since it's right next to the university.  Would stop here again to snack on empanadas!
